c74object.name: ears.out~
c74object.digest: Signal output for a patch loaded by ears.process~
c74object.description: Use the ears.out~ object inside a patch loaded by ears.process~ to create a signal outlet writing data to an output buffer.

metadatalist.metadata: Andrea Agostini, partly based upon work by Alexander J. Harker

objarg.name: outlet_and_channels
objarg.description:
The llll is composed of two parts:
- an integer, setting the number of the ears.process~ object's outlet to which samples will be passed by ears.out~; and
- a sublist containing the channel numbers of the output buffer ears.out~ will write to. A corresponding number of outlets will be created for ears.in~
As a shortcut, if just a flat llll is provided then its first element is interpreted as the outlet number and its subsequent elements are interpreted as the channel indices.
Both parts are optional. If not provided, the output number defaults to 1 and only the first channel will be written to.

method.name: llll
method.description:
The llll is composed of two parts:
- an integer, setting the number of the ears.process~ object's outlet to which samples will be passed by ears.out~; and
- a sublist containing the channel numbers of the output buffer ears.out~ will write to.
As a shortcut, if just a flat llll is provided then its first element is interpreted as the outlet number and its subsequent elements are interpreted as the channel indices.
Both parts are optional. If not provided, the output number defaults to 1 and only the first channel will be written to.
